tags.name: SSO connectors
tags.description:
Endpoints for managing single sign-on (SSO) connectors. Your sign-in experience can use these well-configured SSO connectors to authenticate users and sync user attributes from external identity providers (IdPs).

SSO connectors are created by SSO connector factories.

tags.name: SSO connector factories
tags.description:
Endpoints for SSO (single sign-on) connector factories.

SSO connector factories provide the metadata and configuration templates for creating SSO connectors.

/api/sso-connector-factories.description: SSO connector factories are used to create Enterprise SSO connectors. The created connectors are used to connect to external SSO providers.

get.description: Returns all SSO connector factories, including standard protocol factories and pre-configured SSO providers (e.g. Google Workspace, Okta, etc.).

200.description: An array of SSO connector factories.

get.description: Get SSO connectors with pagination. In addition to the raw SSO connector data, a copy of fetched or parsed IdP configs and a copy of connector factory's data will be attached.

post.description: Create an new SSO connector by a specified connector factory.

422.description: At lease one of the given input fields is invalid or IdP connection cannot be verified with the given config.

get.description: Get SSO connector data by ID. In addition to the raw SSO connector data, a copy of fetched or parsed IdP configs and a copy of connector factory's data will be attached.

200.description: The SSO connector data with the given ID.

delete.description: Delete an SSO connector by ID.

patch.description: Update an SSO connector by ID. This method performs a partial update.

422.description: At lease one of the update fields is invalid or IdP connection can not be verified with the given connection config.
